reviewText:
Wow, would you look at all the negative reviews. Does that scare you? It scared me.

I probably wouldn't have bought the game either, but I got it in a bundle with some other farm simulators. Despite my reluctance I decided to give it a test drive one day and see what all the hate was about.

Ten hours later I came to a conclusion and can now tell you what I think about this unusual game.

First of all, you have to be familiar with farming sims and understand how they are played. If you don't know how to operate the machinery then you are not going to have fun. That brings me to my second point: half of the reviews on here are from people who have absolutely no idea what to do and, instead of looking for help, they decided to nix the game altogether. The other half is from jokesters who jumped on the hate bandwagon because that is the popular thing to do nowdays.

If anyone with the least bit of interest in the subject would have taken the time to learn the game then I think they would have appreciated what the developers have almost succeeded in creating here. I say almost" because I can admit that it is not a perfect game. Yes
date: it does have lots of bugs; and yes
recommended: it is slightly underdeveloped. But no way is it the unplayable disaster that the reviewers here would have you believe. I have played games far far worse than this one.\n\nIt helps to have some prior experience with farming
hoursPlayed: but the game itself is quite easy to learn. I have a rudimentary knowlege of the subject and still didn't know what to do. I found the tutorial videos from the main menu but they would not play. However
voteText:
with a little bit of digging you can find the videos in the game's main folder and watch them from there. You can even read the subtitle files that accompanied the videos with insightful tips. Reading and watching those made the game so much more easier to understand and I have been having fun playing it ever since.

My gameplay experience so far has ranged from average to great. It is a small game without a lot of replayability; so I can't see myself spending any more than 25 - 30 hours on it. But I am enjoying the game for what it is. It's a farm sim set in an historical period; and it's not trying to be anything more than that. The sooner you can accept that the less disappointed you will be.

Maybe I am a bit biased for having such a strong interest in antiquated farming. I've tried recreating the same time period on the more popular farming games without success. Their antique tractors were nice
helpfulPercent: but in the end all it is is modern farming using old machines. But this game is so much more detailed. You actually have to connect implements by hand and get off your tractor each time you want to lower the seeder for planting. And the plowing itself is the most real I've ever seen in a farm sim. Instead of having ready-made fields for you to plow
votesHelpful: you have to decide where you want to grow and start digging up the green. I spent hours on my first day outlining a field in my backyard and plowing a sizable portion of the yard. After cultivating
votesTotal: fertilizing and planting I'm now waiting for my first crops to show.\n\nThis game also features the most animal interaction I've ever seen. You have to keep them stocked up on hay and grass. The bales can be stored in the barn loft and
commentsCount: they must be thrown down to the bottom floor and placed in designated locations. Milk and eggs can also be collected and sold at the local market. Unfortunately the animals do not move much
column16: but you can walk them to places you want them to be. You can also breed them for their offspring and sell your old animals. And make sure you don't scare the chickens too far away or they may die of starvation.\n\nThe machine models
column18: are some of the best-looking in a game like this. They all look beautiful and shiny and historically accurate. There are a few different tractors you can purchase
column19: including a John Deere model; not sure how they were able to acquire that license. The implements are varied and also look good. Antique plows
column23: wagons and more have been perfectly modeled. Even the harvester is one of the old ones that is pulled behind the tractor; something I haven't been able to find in any other game.\n\nI plan to spend more time on this game because I am actually enjoying it. However I do wish they would patch it with fixes and added incentives. There is a gas station in the game
column24: but you never run out of gas. Was this a planned but cancelled feature? Also you can sell logs
column25: but no way to chop down trees? That's disappointing when you realize that the game could have been so much better with a little bit more work. But
column27: it is not a terrible game.\n\nSo far I have experienced no game-breaking bugs. There was an incident in which all of my animals disappeared
column28: but I reloaded an older save and they returned. Some times the game does lock up when launching
column29: but closing and relaunching usually helps. There are some minor physics issues
column30: but the solution to that is don't do stupid stuff. This is not an FPS. Treat it with a little bit of delicacy. Why would you be doing silly stunts when you should be farming? The only real annoying thing that occured was when one of my pigs and dog became stuck and I couldn't move them. I drove the tractor through them and they returned to normal. Sometimes it's the simplest solutions that save the day.\n\nEven though I wish more work could have been done
column31: I am still happy to have discovered this fascinating game. I would like others to enjoy it too
column32: but I guess you can't please everyone."

reviewText: If you get this game you have to be prepared to overlook the bugs and issues that are almost certain to crop up. Despite this, it is nicely detailed with some good quality machinery models and some accurate history behind them. The game can get boring at points but overall is quite satisfying to play. For those of you who are familiar with Farming Simulator, this game has more manual labour involved in farming but is less of a game. A nice alternative to relax a bit and farm!

reviewText:
My experience with this game was brief: I started it up, the menu was unusable until I knocked the settings down to lowest.
I loaded into the game, looked at the relatively pretty graphics, the animal AI, wondered what to do, mashed buttons
Eventually got into my tractor, excited, drove around the farm.
Bumped into a wall. Tractor is now upside down, my head has clipped through the floor, and the graphics don't refresh: http://imgur.com/xwQhm6Y
Mash buttons again, find that Q resets tractor. Buy some items to do farming things, try to connect them to tractor: item flies into space, tractor spins around a bit on the ground.
If you want an unintentional Goat Simulator clone, get this game. If you want a farming simulator, or a fun game, don't.

reviewText:
5AM
I woke up, after a nice cup of tea I got in my working boots and walked outside.
There I saw this beautiful world. With country music in the background I hopped over the fence to check the lifestock. After that I saw my dog tailwagging in the distance, I walked up to her and fed her some fresh chicken. Bltches love fresh chicken.

9AM
Time for work!
I unlocked my barn and checked the cages. Cages? Yes, cages. What is Historical Farming without slaves!
In the back of the barn, one of the slaves was whining that he was out of water. Tyrone was his name.
I broke his knee. No watermelon dessert for him tonight!

11AM
Little nephew came to visit my farm via multiplayer. I gave him a stick so he could poke the slaves. It's good motivation for them too!

1PM
Market time!
Bought an upgrade for my whip. Also got some new chains! Sweet!

5PM
Tyrone was bltching again. Freaking Tyrone. He picked cotton 'till dinner.

8PM
Dinner time!
Gave my cows and sheep some hay. And got my ♥♥♥♥♥♥s some fresh slaughtered chicken. Sometimes they try to write letters with the feathers from the chicken. unfortunately ♥♥♥♥♥♥s can't write (Shhhh, don't tell them, it confuses them and makes them sad). slaves have to stay in good and healthy shape too, or they won't dance for you if you ask them. I gave them some watermelon dessert after. And gave everyone the rest of the evening off, the ♥♥♥♥♥♥s were happy and playing basketball. Except Tyrone, I didn't let him out of his cage. Freaking Tyrone.




8/10 Engine could be better, and the torture system a lot wider. Sometimes one of the slaves glitches out of his cage, and I have to whip him back in before it starts screwing my sheep. It's even worse at night, I can't see them. A stigmatise feature would be great too so I could recognise them better.
If you're looking for a great, historical accurate simulation game. This is the one for you!

reviewText:
Where's the mud?
Well, you look around and find yourself in a farmyard that might have come from an old picturebook of the early fifties. You turn around and see your dog, running towards you. You see your chicken, your pigs... well and Bessy, the old cow. And then you see your old tractor and...

No, I am not kidding, this is actually what this game looks like, but take care, you have to finetune the graphics a lot, if you don't you are in for some bad surprises. The game is... difficult to describe, it has some charm, yet it lacks a lot of important features. Actually you are quite in a freestyle mode, but without a lot of realism. Well actually, the graphics look nice and crisp but the game itself, it's lacking - and the game even isn't that realistical.

Driving around with your tractor will give you the first lesson, there is no mud in Historical Farming, the tractor looks like out of the showroom even after heavy duty farmwork... You can enter the barn, throw hay and stuff down... but, thats about all you might do. There is a tutorial, yes, it helps you to get the game straight... if you want to call it game. I prefer the category, Glorified Walking Simulator"... Tuscany

reviewText: Agricultural Simulator: Historical Farming, takes the Agricultural Simulator series of games on a time-traveling trip back to mid 20th century world of Farming. Using vintage equipment, you can create your own workable farm. Agricultural Simulator: Historical Farming also allows you to Co-Op play with a friend, so you can work a farm together. The game basically plays the same way as Agricultural Simulator 2013, but without the newer equipment, which makes it more of a challenge. This particular game does not appear to have a playable tutorial the way Agricultural Simulator 2013 did, but there are places online where you can download a free demo, so I would recommend doing that before purchasing the game so you know exactly what you are getting into before you spend money.\n\nI think as a simulator, this game is no different then other Agricultural Simulators and would probably have been a better DLC to Agri Sim 2013, as opposed to a standalone. In any case, it's not a bad game and should present a decent challenge to fan's of the Agricultural Simulator games.

reviewText: Enjoy being a farmer between 1950 and 1970 in the Agricultural Simulator – Historical Farming. The game takes you to the good old days and you will experience the charming farming of the 60's and 70's. Fans of nostalgia and history will be glad to work with original designed machines and to till a field with well known Old-timer Tractors. With the new feature – the dynamic ground Agrar Simulator – Historical Farming presents the first real furrows which will be left when working at the fields with strong machines. The furrows will have impact on the driving behavior of the tractors and guarantee pure realism. It is up to the player to decide in which region he would like to cultivate his farm. There are two amazing scenarios – idyllic highlands, valleys and woods in the alp-region or the fascinating Toscana region with measured climate.

Actual playbility?  Get Farm Simulator and be infinitely happier.

reviewText:
NOTE! You can't leave a rewire on steam without playing it for 5 min. It crashes on start. Most people that have this problem won't leave a review as I had to alt tab for 5 minutes after opening the game in order to do so.

The game crashed after the initial splash screens, went to the forums and lots of people are having the problem. There are lots of bad reviews on the forums :/

Edit: after 5 minutes of alt tab I got promped with a broken error submission screen.

I'm running an i7-5820K 6-Core which can run every other game I have played without issue. This is the first one I can't get  past the developer splash screens.

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Disclaimer: I received this game as part of a bundle. $219 for 8 Simulater games.

After watching a Youtube video, it still took me 5 min to figure out how to get the pigs in the stalls. There is a chicken coop, and tons of chickens, but I couldn't figure out how to get the chickens in the coop. I hear cows....
Can't find the cows.
After standing next to the tractor for another 5 min. wildly pressing buttons, I finally managed to get on the tractor.
Opened store to buy equipment.
Game crashed to desktop.

Well, that was a waste of 20min.
Even though I only paid 1/8th of $2.19 for this technically.. I still feel ripped off.
Graphics are bad.. Controls are bad, The entire interface is needlessly over complicated. Lots of Icons implying that there is stuff you can interact with.. but how? That's the big question.
